original: Ericson, Olof Ragnar, rederiinspektör, Kalmar, f. 15/8/82 i Kalmar av sjökapt. Olof Fredrik E. o. Augusta Sofia Holmström. G. 20 m. Kerstin Andersson. Barn: Birger f. 21, Erik 26, Kerstin 28. — Elev v. Kalmar h. a. 1. t. 97, prakt, utbildn. å verkst. o varv samt å in- o. uti. fartyg 98-03, övermaskin :ex. i Karlskrona 08. Anst. v. flottan 04-13, övermaskinist à olika fartyg 14-17, statens fartygsinsp. i Karlstad 18, rederiinsp. i Bro’strömska koncernen 19-21, rederiinsp. samt tra-fikinsp. ’ i Angb. A-B Kalmarsund i Kalmar sed. 22. Led. av Sv. tekn:-fören. sed. 26.
translated: Ericson, Olof Ragnar was a shipping inspector from Kalmar. He was born on August 15, 1882 in Kalmar to sea captain Olof Fredrik E. and Augusta Sofia Holmström. He married Kerstin Andersson in 1920 and they had three children: Birger (born 1921), Erik (born 1926), and Kerstin (born 1928). He attended Kalmar Technical School from 1897 to 1903 and received practical training in shipyards and on board ships during that time. He became a chief engineer in Karlskrona in 1908 and worked for the navy from 1904 to 1913, serving as a chief engineer on various ships from 1914 to 1917. He worked as a state ship inspector in Karlstad in 1918, a shipping inspector for the Broström Group from 1919 to 1921, and as a shipping and traffic inspector for Angb. A-B Kalmarsund in Kalmar from 1922. He was a member of the Swedish Society of Engineering from 1926.
